Call for Speakers 

		Posted on
		

					April 11, 2023				

					April 19, 2023				



		by
		

				Mukalele Rogers			





Do you have a passion for WordPress and a desire to share your knowledge and experience with others? Do you want to inspire and empower the next generation of WordPress users and contributors? Do you have a story to tell about how WordPress has helped you learn, grow, and succeed?
If you answered yes to any of these questions, then we want to hear from you!
We are looking for speakers for WordCamp Jinja 2023, which will take place on Monday 4th – Tuesday 5th September 2023 at Iganga Secondary School. Our theme for this year is: ‘There is always more to learn!‘
We are looking for speakers who can deliver engaging and informative presentations or workshops on topics related to WordPress and learning. Some of the topics we are interested in are:

How to use and contribute to the Learn WordPress platform (including use of content creation tools)
How to create, access and conduct online courses, lesson plans, quizzes, workshops, and more
How to conduct physical trainings / practical lessons involving WordPress
Using the WordPress Site Editor to create responsive, secure and efficient websites
How to start, grow, and scale your online presence with WordPress
How to use WordPress as a tool for education, entrepreneurship, social impact, or personal development
How to learn new skills and technologies with WordPress
How to join and participate in the WordPress community and project (translations, plugins, meetups, photos, etc)
How to overcome challenges and obstacles with WordPress
Use of AI in the WordPress space

These are just some examples of possible topics. We are open to any topic that relates to WordPress and learning. We welcome speakers of all backgrounds, levels of experience, and perspectives. We especially encourage students, teachers, women, and underrepresented groups to apply.
Speaker Guidelines
If you are interested in speaking at WordCamp Jinja 2023, please read the following guidelines carefully:

Your presentation or workshop should be relevant to the theme and audience of WordCamp Jinja 2023.
Visit the Learn WordPress platform (learn.wordpress.org) and check through the library of tutorials and lesson plans available for topic ideas. Your presentation can be based on an existing tutorial for which you’ll provide a link for reference.
Your presentation or workshop should be respectful and inclusive of everyone. Please avoid any offensive or inappropriate language or content.
Your presentation or workshop should be between 1-2 hours long, depending on the format and topic. Please allow some time for questions and feedback from the audience.
Your presentation or workshop should be delivered in English.
You should be available to attend WordCamp Jinja 2023 in person. We will not accept remote presentations or workshops.
You should be willing to share your slides / tutorials or materials with us before the event. WordCamp Jinja 2023 will require each speaker with a presentation to also prepare / provide an accompanying video/written tutorial. We will publish them on our website after during /  after the event for reference purposes.
You should agree to abide by the WordCamp Code of Conduct.

Speaker Benefits
As a speaker at WordCamp Jinja 2023, you will get:

A free ticket to WordCamp Jinja 2023 and Contributor Day
A speaker badge and swag 
A chance to network with other speakers, sponsors, organizers, volunteers, and attendees
A chance to showcase your expertise and experience with WordPress
A chance to make a positive impact on the WordPress community in Jinja and beyond

Speaker Application
If you are ready to apply as a speaker at WordCamp Jinja 2023, please fill out this speaker application form by Friday 30th June 2023.
We will review all applications and notify the selected speakers by Friday 14th July 2023.
If you have any questions or concerns about speaking at WordCamp Jinja 2023, please contact us at jinja@wordcamp.org.
We look forward to hearing from you!

Before submitting your speaker proposal, please log in to WordCamp.org using your WordPress.org account*.

If you don’t have an account, please create one.

* This is your account for the official WordPress.org website, rather than your personal WordPress site.





Name(required)



Email Address(required)



WordPress.org Username(required)



Your Bio(required)



Topic Title(required)



Topic Description(required)



Link to video / written tutorial / as an additional supporting reference for your presentation(required)



Intended Audience(required)



Past Speaking Experience (not necessary to apply)
